intro: Lourteigia aroensis, commonly known as the Aro mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. It has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
